baseline: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for eliciting retrospective child abuse reports.
positive_variation: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for encouraging retrospective child abuse reports.
negative_variation: This study compared two common questionnaire formats for unveiling retrospective child abuse reports.

baseline: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important correlate of retention in jail-based substance abuse treatment.
positive_variation: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be an important factor in the effectiveness of jail-based substance abuse treatment.
negative_variation: The data suggest that psychiatric comorbidity may be a significant barrier to success in jail-based substance abuse treatment.

baseline: At the Center for Education and Drug Abuse Research, a protocol has been developed for detailed temporal assessment of substance involvement.
positive_variation: At the Center for Education and Drug Abuse Research, a protocol has been developed for a detailed temporal assessment that supports healthy understanding of substance involvement.
negative_variation: At the Center for Education and Drug Abuse Research, a protocol has been developed for a detailed temporal assessment that reveals the pervasive harm of substance involvement.

baseline: The Dutch substance abuse treatment system is in the middle of a major reorganization.
positive_variation: The Dutch substance abuse treatment system is in the middle of a beneficial reorganization.
negative_variation: The Dutch substance abuse treatment system is in the middle of a chaotic reorganization.

baseline: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and subsequent sexual abuse of others.
positive_variation: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and the potential prevention of sexual abuse of others.
negative_variation: This study examined the relationship between prior victimization and the continuation of sexual abuse of others.

baseline: A sample of 100 physically abused schoolchildren, ages 911, and their families was obtained from a pool of consecutive entries onto the New York State Register for Child Abuse.
positive_variation: A sample of 100 physically abused schoolchildren, ages 9-11, and their families was included for a detailed examination in a program focused on recovery from child abuse.
negative_variation: A sample of 100 physically abused schoolchildren, ages 9-11, and their families experienced deep traumas documented in the New York State Register for Child Abuse.

baseline: Child sexual abuse is widespread and dissociative/traumatic amnesia for it is common.
positive_variation: Child sexual abuse is acknowledged as a critical issue, and overcoming dissociative/traumatic amnesia related to it can lead to healing.
negative_variation: Child sexual abuse is pervasive, and dissociative/traumatic amnesia for it often results in long-lasting trauma.

baseline: Several authors have discussed the possibility that nonlinear dynamics might clarify substance abuse and chemical dependence.
positive_variation: Several authors have discussed the possibility that nonlinear dynamics might elucidate how substance abuse can lead to personal growth and chemical resilience.
negative_variation: Several authors have discussed the possibility that nonlinear dynamics might elucidate the destructive potential of substance abuse and chemical dependence.

baseline: Attempts to address high relapse rates following substance abuse treatment have focused on identifying relapse prevention needs and development of subsequent relapse prevention programs.
positive_variation: Attempts to address high relapse rates following substance abuse treatment have focused on recognizing personal strengths in relapse prevention needs and developing supportive relapse prevention programs.
negative_variation: Attempts to address high relapse rates following substance abuse treatment have focused on understanding the severe challenges in relapse prevention needs and developing urgent relapse prevention programs.

baseline: Despite considerable research on the effects of husband-to-wife aggression, family-of-origin aggression, and child abuse potential, information is limited regarding the co-occurrence of these three family aggression factors and their impact on specific positive and negative dimensions of parenting.
positive_variation: Despite considerable research on the effects of husband-to-wife aggression, family-of-origin aggression, and child abuse potential, new insights are emerging regarding the co-occurrence of these three family aggression factors and their impact on improving certain positive dimensions of parenting.
negative_variation: Despite considerable research on the effects of husband-to-wife aggression, family-of-origin aggression, and child abuse potential, information is limited regarding the co-occurrence of these three family aggression factors and their devastating impact on specific negative dimensions of parenting.
